docs.title: 👋 Welcome
docs.text:
Hi, I’m Abhilash Sagar.

This is my hub for all embedded Linux notes and weekly updates.

docs.title: My First Weekly Note
docs.text: This is my first weekly blog post. I’ll be posting updates every week on Linux device drivers, Yocto, RTOS, and my Kaage Pi SBC project.

docs.title: Kaage Pi — A ₹2 K Linux SBC built from scratch
docs.text: Booting Linux on a hand-soldered Allwinner V3s board.

docs.title: Why I Built It
docs.text:
I wanted to see if a usable Linux single-board computer could be built in India for under ₹2 K using open components and simple tools. The Allwinner V3s SoC (ARM Cortex-A7 + 64 MB DDR2 RAM) made it possible, a single chip capable of running Debian Linux without external RAM.

This page documents the journey — from loose components on my desk to a working Debian shell prompt.

docs.title: Resources & Tutorials That Helped
docs.text: I learned a lot from open-source communities and amazing YouTube creators while building Kaage Pi. Here are a few that guided me through PCB design, power circuits, and Linux bring-up:

docs.title: Embedded Linux & SBC Design
docs.text:
• Simon Richards – Allwinner V3S SBC – Detailed build of an SBC with Allwinner V3s, great reference.
  • wtarreau – BreadBee: Build Your Own Single Board – Blog post covering the full hardware/software build of an open SBC.
  • Popovicu – Making My First Embedded Linux System – A beginner-friendly walk-through of embedding Linux on bare hardware.
  • GitHub – balmerdx/AllwinnerV3S_KiCad – Open KiCad project for V3s boards, used as a layout reference and inspiration.

Phil’s Lab – KiCad PCB Layout Tips – Clear explanation of high-speed routing, decoupling, and ground planes.

Phil’s Lab – Switch-Mode Power Supply Layout – Helped me design the PT4103/AP3032 backlight section.

EEVblog – Soldering Fine-Pitch ICs – Practical tricks for soldering the V3s QFP package by hand.

If any of these videos helped you too, make sure to support the creators — their content accelerates so many open-hardware projects like this one.
